page.title: 09THE AVON CAUSEWAY
page.content: The{River Avon}runs straight through our area from north to south and it creates problems with communications between{Hurn}in the west and{Sopley}in the east. There is one road which crosses the river and this has been raised above the level of the flood plain. This is the only bridging point on the eight mile stretch between the A.35 at { {Christchurch}and the A.31 at{Ringwood. { } At the edge of the flood plain on the heathland which rises up towards the{Ramsdown Plantation}and this is where the{Christchurch}to{Ringwood} railway used to run. The old{Hurn {station}has now been turned into a public house (The Avon Causeway) and there is also a poultry farm and a church nearby.
